artefact.overview: You must tell DVLA if you have sleep apnoea - download the correct form to let them know
artefact.body:
You must tell DVLA if you have sleep apnoea.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

Fill in form SL1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘SL1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 189KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

Fill in form SL1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘SL1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 240KB)

Driving while tired

For further information on the dangers of driving while tired, download the leaflet ‘Tiredness can kill’.

Download ‘Tiredness can kill’ (PDF, 281KB)
